Author: DutchFinity
Body: SCAM ALERT  The latest news on the website:  Stater as a project has been sold to a team of developers that want to take a different approach to it. Thus we are obligated to issue refunds to all the investors that supported Stater Project.  Bounty participants will not be paid! Adressing the issue at Telegram will get your removed from the group!  Assigning work to people, agreeing upon a pay for it, and then after the work is done refusing to pay has a name:  SCAM!  As if translating an ANN, website and a many paged whitepaper is nothing! So this who friendly mr. Andy is for real! He could have paid the bounty workers from the money earned from the sale. But no; everything is for mr. Andy Stater with his deep deep pockets! Absolutely worthless!

Author: 404moneynotfound
Body: DutchFinity you are wrong, they cannot give the money that investors gave to bounty hunters. This money will be refunded as they say to the people who paid(including me) to get nodes and coins. We are waiting to get our money back as they promised. If they gave this money to bounty hunters and then they could not refund me, this would be a scam. I think the refund is a very honest move for the team, and first of all the investors must get their money back.

Author: DutchFinity
Body: Did you think bounty workers didn't invest in Stater? You invested with money and I invested with time and energy. Do you know how much time it took me to translate their 20 paged whitepaper, the website, ANN thread, news messages? I invested quite a bit in Stater, and nothing is returned! That is just as much a scam. And of course mr. Andy received a nice amount of money with the sale from which he could have easily paid me and other bounty workers. It is just greed and scam that he doesn't.

Author: Andy.P.Stater
Body: STATER ICO UPDATE  We would like to address a few concerns regarding our ICO, and make some changes that we see fit to take Stater forward.  1. All unsold Stater coins will be burned after the ICO. Stater is created as a medium for crypto investors to use and spend their Cryptocurrencies without having to convert them to fiat, thus from the first moment we aimed the majority of coins to be distributed amongst different investors. There is no point on the unsold coins remaining in our possession.  2. The price of Stater in ICO will be 0.000125 BTC from the initial 0.000250 BTC. The reason behind our decision has to do with the massive increase on Bitcoin. When Stater was created as an idea, and later when it was announced the Bitcoin price was much lower that it is today.  3. All early investors will be rewarded with a 50% bonus. All our investors who bought Stater they bought it in the discount price of 0.000125 BTC. We will compensate every one of you with 50% more Stater coins. (It will not apply on nodes). For those who bought nodes, the additional 50% will be given in Stater coins as well. Meaning anyone who bought a Masternode will get 500 more Stater coins, and everyone who bought a Meganode will get 5,000 more Stater coins. Snapshots was taken on (7–11–2017)  4. ICO will be extended to December 15 2017. We received numerous emails and messages requesting an extension to our ICO. Many of the potential investors are trapped due to the massive drop of altcoins and they would like to have some extra time to move their BTC to participate in our ICO. We plan to have Stater listed on exchanges on December, and that will not be affected by the extension of our ICO.  Thank you so much for your support.  For any questions please join our telegram group: https://t.me/StaterChat  Sincerely Stater Team

Author: CryptoLex
Body: Good to see you guys will burn the unsold coins! This will make my coins more valuable

Author: Andy.P.Stater
Body: Our goal is to create a valuable Cryptocurrency and we will do everything we can to make that happen.  Burning any remaining Stater coins after the ICO is over is only the first step to our goal. More will follow so stay tuned!

Author: adu1t
Body: Will I get 50% bonus if I buy node now?  If someone buys 1000 coins but he hasn't masternode key he won't be able to run a masternode? What is the purpose of doing that? For me it seems that people won't buy a coin if they aren't able to run a masternode.

Author: Andy.P.Stater
Body: Hi,  First yes you will be able to get 50% if you buy now, there about 500,000 STAT left unsold, offering the 50% Bonus.  Our masternodes are limited, we are the only Masternode Coin who does that. The reason is to have a stable ROI that will not change in time. The reason to have coins is that you want to use them on our platforms, not all people are Masternode/ Meganode holders. Last, if you have a 1000 STAT and you want to form a Masternode you will have the option to apply for it, go in a waiting list, and if a masternode space is open (only 1,500 masternodes) you will receive a key and instructions to host yours.  The application form will go public after the end of the ICO.

Body: Is there any update about the wallet? Also why do you have a limit for each person (nodes, coins)?  Your project seems solid and with reliable team, I will surely support you

Author: Andy.P.Stater
Body: First, thank you for your support,  The Wallet is ready we are running some final tests and it will be released before the ICO starts. We have a limit amount of nodes for each person because we want more people to own the nodes. There is a voting system in place and we want the opinion of the many! We do not want all coins to be bought by one person but to be divided amongst many users!

Author: jack19123
Body: Why does this need an ICO?

Author: Ahooleeman
Body: Statercoin is listed at https://foxico.io/project/stater

Author: Andy.P.Stater
Body: For a few reasons: 1. The coin will serve a purpose, not been useless like most coins out there. 2. We need to build three platforms 3. We need to develop 6 apps for the project (3android, 3 iOS)  We already have created a Wallet and Stater Coin without even any financial resources.  Stater is something our team believes in and we will make sure it will be implemented.  My suggestion is to support coins that have a purpose, a plan and a vision rather buying coins that need 2-3 years to create their "fantastic" project
